Description: All new components should be standalone — no NgModule required
Do: Set standalone: true in @Component decorator
Don't: Create new NgModules for simple components

Description: Prefer signals over BehaviorSubject for reactive state
Do: Use signal() and computed() for component state
Don't: Use BehaviorSubject for simple local state

Description: Use signal-based inputs and outputs (Angular 17+)
Do: Use input() and output() functions instead of decorators
Don't: Use @Input() and @Output() decorators in new components

Description: Keep components under 200 lines with single responsibility
Do: Break large components into smaller child components
Don't: Create god components handling multiple responsibilities

Description: All components should use ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush
Do: Set changeDetection: ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush
Don't: Use default change detection — causes excessive re-renders
Code Bad: Default change detection on complex tree

Description: Use @if @for @switch instead of *ngIf *ngFor (Angular 17+)
Do: Use built-in control flow: @if @for @switch @defer
Don't: Use structural directives *ngIf *ngFor in new code

Description: Defer heavy components until needed with @defer blocks
Do: Use @defer with triggers for below-fold content
Don't: Eagerly load all components regardless of visibility

Description: Always provide track function in @for to optimize rendering
Do: Specify track expression for list identity tracking
Don't: Omit track — Angular warns and performance suffers

Description: Lazy load feature routes with loadComponent/loadChildren
Do: Use loadComponent for standalone component routes
Don't: Import all route components eagerly

Description: Write route guards as functional guards (Angular 15+)
Do: Use inject() in functional guards instead of class guards
Don't: Create class-based CanActivate guards

Description: Use Router.navigate with type-safe route params
Do: Use RouterLink with typed paths and param objects
Don't: Build route strings manually with concatenation

Guideline: Use signal store for shared state
Description: Use @ngrx/signals or custom signal-based stores for shared state
Do: Create signal-based stores for cross-component state
Don't: Use RxJS BehaviorSubjects for everything
Code Good: export const CounterStore = signalStore({ count: signal(0) })

Description: Use effect() to run side effects when signals change
Do: Use effect() for logging and API calls on signal changes
Don't: Manually subscribe to observables for signal-derived effects

Description: Prefer async pipe or toSignal() over manual subscribe
Do: Use toSignal() to convert observables to signals
Don't: Call .subscribe() manually and forget to unsubscribe

Description: Prefer inject() function over constructor injection
Do: Use inject() in components and functions for cleaner code
Don't: Constructor-inject everything with long parameter lists
Code Good: private http = inject(HttpClient); private router = inject(Router)
Code Bad: constructor(private http: HttpClient, private router: Router, ...)

Description: Use InjectionToken for configuration values
Do: Create typed InjectionTokens for app configuration
Don't: Use string tokens or magic values for config

Guideline: Use reactive forms for complex inputs
Description: Use FormBuilder with typed FormGroups
Do: Use Reactive Forms with strong typing for complex forms
Don't: Use template-driven forms for complex validation logic

Description: Use strictly typed FormGroup with NonNullableFormBuilder
Do: Use NonNullableFormBuilder for type-safe form values
Don't: Use untyped FormGroup — runtime errors on typos
Code Bad: new FormGroup({ name: new FormControl() }) // untyped

Description: Always type HTTP responses with interfaces
Do: Define response interfaces and type HttpClient calls
Don't: Use any or untyped responses

Description: Write HTTP interceptors as functions (Angular 15+)
Do: Use functional interceptors with provideHttpClient
Don't: Create class-based interceptors

Description: Always provide trackBy function for *ngFor (legacy code)
Do: Supply trackBy for all list iterations in legacy templates
Don't: Omit trackBy — entire list re-renders on change

Description: Use esbuild-based builder for fast builds (Angular 17+)
Do: Use @angular-devkit/build-angular:application builder
Don't: Use legacy Webpack builder for new projects

Description: Experiment with zoneless change detection (Angular 18+)
Do: Use provideExperimentalZonelessChangeDetection() with signals
Don't: Mix zone.js patterns with zoneless — inconsistent behavior

Description: Use Angular Testing Library for component tests
Do: Write tests from user perspective with Testing Library
Don't: Test implementation details and internal state

Description: Enable server-side rendering with @angular/ssr
Do: Use ng add @angular/ssr for SSR setup
Don't: Skip SSR for content-heavy public pages
Code Good: ng add @angular/ssr // sets up Express server

Description: Enable client hydration for SSR pages (Angular 16+)
Do: Use provideClientHydration() in app config
Don't: Destroy and recreate DOM after SSR — causes flicker
Code Bad: Full client-side re-render after SSR page load

Description: Keep styles scoped to components with styleUrls or styles
Do: Use component-scoped styles with view encapsulation
Don't: Put all styles in global stylesheet — conflicts and specificity wars
Code Bad: All styles in styles.css with deep selectors

Description: Define theme with CSS custom properties
Do: Use CSS variables for dynamic theming and dark mode
Don't: Hardcode colors in component styles

Description: Use @angular/cdk/a11y for focus management
Do: Use FocusTrap and LiveAnnouncer from CDK
Don't: Build custom focus management from scratch

Description: Sanitize dynamic HTML/URLs with Angular's DomSanitizer
Do: Use bypassSecurityTrustHtml only for truly trusted content
Don't: Bypass security for user-generated content

Description: Organize code by feature not by type
Do: Group components/services/models by feature folder
Don't: Create components/ services/ models/ folders at root

Description: Use environment.ts for config that varies by deploy target
Do: Use environment files for API URLs and feature flags
Don't: Hardcode API URLs or use string literals

Description: Support system preference detection with manual override
Do: Use prefers-color-scheme + manual toggle with localStorage
Don't: Hardcode light-only theme
Code Bad: All colors hardcoded as light theme only

Description: Use HttpClient with EventSource for AI streaming responses
Do: Stream AI responses with progressive rendering
Don't: Wait for complete AI response before showing

Description: Implement cookie consent before tracking
Do: Show consent banner and only track after opt-in
Don't: Load analytics scripts before consent
